I'd highly recommend watching "Taxi Driver" (1976), a thought-provoking drama directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Robert De Niro. The story revolves around a troubled Vietnam War veteran who works as a taxi driver in New York City, and his journey of self-discovery and redemption. It's a powerful film that delves deep into the darker aspects of society.

If you're looking for something more recent, "Paycheck" (2003) featuring Ben Affleck might be worth checking out.
